neighbors.name: Dr Acquisitions Llc
neighbors.claims: DR Acquisitions LLC is a West Virginia limited liability company formed on July 29, 2004, with a stated purpose of residential building construction [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=228584). State filings list Dan Ryan of Frederick, Maryland, as the sole managing member, linking the entity to the DRB Group (formerly Dan Ryan Builders), a major regional homebuilder [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=228584). As of late 2025 and early 2026, the entity is actively seeking planning commission approval for Phase 4 of the 'Huntfield' neighborhood, a large mixed-use residential development in Charles Town [WV Legals](https://wvlegals.com/public-hearing-152/). The company has also requested amendments for recreational facilities within the Huntfield development, indicating ongoing active management of their land holdings [Spirit of Jefferson Legal Ads](https://wvlegals.com/legal-ads-feb-13-2025-spirit-of-jefferson/). The entity's property interests are strictly tied to residential expansion and development [Charles Town Planning Commission](https://d3n9y02raazwpg.cloudfront.net/charlestownwv/3a933cec-86e6-11ed-9024-0050569183fa-c3406839-89eb-44b9-8ad4-c6ca2b8d008b-1692890298.pdf).
neighbors.influence_justification: Major regional developer actively expanding the 'Huntfield' subdivision; regularly appears before Planning Commission; significant economic stakeholder in local housing market.

motivations: Visual aesthetics for future home sales
approach_recommendations.engage: Engage principal Dan Ryan or legal representatives regarding the Huntfield expansion; ensure project buffers align with their residential site plans to prevent opposition based on visual impact to their future home sales.

neighbors.profile_summary: Holding company for DRB Group (Dan Ryan Builders), currently active in permitting Phase 4 of the Huntfield subdivision.

citations.claim: Formed on July 29, 2004, with a stated purpose of residential building construction

neighbors.name: Winchester Cold Storage Co Inc
neighbors.claims: Winchester Cold Storage Company, Inc. is a Virginia-based cold logistics and orchard company registered in West Virginia since 2002 [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=206926). The company is led by President John Scully IV and Vice-President Harry F. Byrd III, representing prominent regional families involved in real estate and agriculture [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=206926). In June 2023, the Jefferson County Historic Landmarks Commission voted unanimously to designate the Winchester Cold Storage Building as a Jefferson County Historic Landmark, citing its significance to the regional apple industry [JCHLC Minutes June 2023](http://jeffersoncountyhlc.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/JCHLC-Minutes-June-7-2023.pdf). The facility, located west of Charles Town, has been operational since the mid-20th century and remains a functional part of the agricultural supply chain [JCHLC Nomination Report](http://jeffersoncountyhlc.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/Nomination-report-Winchester-Cold-Storage-Building-.pdf). John Scully IV is also a prominent realtor and former Winchester City Council member, indicating high community connectivity [Colony Realty Agent Profile](https://colonysells.com/agents/john-s-scully-iv/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Property is a designated Historic Landmark (2023); leadership includes the Byrd family (political dynasty) and John Scully IV (prominent realtor/civic leader).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with extreme care regarding visual impacts; acknowledge the 2023 Historic Landmark designation immediately. Frame the project as compatible with the working agricultural history of the site rather than industrial intrusion.

neighbors.profile_summary: Historic agricultural logistics company owned by influential Byrd and Scully families; property is a designated County Historic Landmark.

citations.claim: Registered in West Virginia since 2002

neighbors.name: Tuscawilla Hills Citizens Association Inc
neighbors.claims: Tuscawilla Hills Citizens Association Inc is the homeowners’ association for the Tuscawilla Hills subdivision, incorporated in West Virginia on January 30, 1976 [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=29509). The community consists of single-family homes built primarily in the 1970s, with amenities including a basketball court and common grounds [Zillow Property Details](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/51-Packett-Dr-Charles-Town-WV-25414/22562023_zpid/). The HOA has been listed in tax lien notices in the past, specifically regarding a 'Notice to Redeem' in 2019 for delinquent taxes on a lot within the subdivision [Spirit of Jefferson](https://bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com/spiritofjefferson.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/0/4d/04d5c020-709c-11eb-8ea6-db5cbbaf5b54/602c35eebe254.pdf.pdf). The association is professionally managed, with recent filings listing Clagett Management in Martinsburg as the point of contact [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=132879).
neighbors.influence_justification: Represents a significant residential block (~500 units); professionally managed; history of tax administrative issues suggests potential disorganization or financial constraints.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact Clagett Management to reach the board; be aware of potential financial sensitivities given the tax lien history. Focus on how the project will not burden their common resources.

neighbors.profile_summary: HOA for Tuscawilla Hills subdivision; professionally managed but has history of tax liens on common parcels.

citations.claim: Incorporated in West Virginia on January 30, 1976

neighbors.name: Turner B Guilford & Linda S-Tr
neighbors.claims: The property is held in trust by B. Guilford Turner and Linda S. Turner. B. Guilford Turner (Rev. B. Guilford Turner) was a local pastor who officiated numerous services in Jefferson County before his passing [Spirit of Jefferson](https://sjf.stparchive.com/Archive/SJF/SJF05061999P02.php). Linda S. Turner is a licensed real estate broker in West Virginia with Coldwell Banker Stuart and Watts, holding certifications in green building (GREEN) and internet professionalism (ePRO) [Coldwell Banker Agent Profile](https://www.coldwellbanker.com/wv/lewisburg/agents/linda-turner/aid-P00200000FDdtRrOb7CZMGig16uRFFCRUr9KLqMi). The trust structure indicates estate planning for the family assets. Linda Turner's professional background in real estate suggests a high level of sophistication regarding land value and property rights.
neighbors.influence_justification: Linda Turner is a real estate professional with local market knowledge; family has long-standing ties to the community (pastoral history).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Linda Turner as a real estate professional; be prepared for detailed questions regarding property value impacts. Her 'GREEN' certification may indicate openness to renewable energy if presented as value-additive.

neighbors.profile_summary: Family trust associated with local real estate agent Linda Turner and the late Rev. B. Guilford Turner.

citations.claim: B. Guilford Turner was a local pastor who officiated numerous services
citations.title: Spirit of Jefferson - Obituary/Service Records

citations.claim: Linda S. Turner is a licensed real estate broker in West Virginia with Coldwell Banker
citations.title: Coldwell Banker - Linda Turner Agent Profile

neighbors.name: Locust Hill Unitowner'S Association Inc
neighbors.claims: Locust Hill Unitowner’s Association Inc is the homeowners’ association for the Locust Hill golf-course community, incorporated in West Virginia on October 22, 1990 [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=132879). The community is professionally managed by Clagett Management Services in Martinsburg [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=132879). The HOA is highly active in enforcing community standards, evidenced by a 2024-2025 legal battle (Wilber v. Locust Hill Unit Owner's Association, Inc.) regarding a resident's display of a flag, which resulted in a jury verdict favoring the Association [Justia Law](https://law.justia.com/cases/west-virginia/intermediate-court-of-appeals/2025/24-ica-270.html). The association also maintains active vigilance over the property, recently issuing alerts regarding trespassers in the wooded areas [Locust Hill Community Blog](https://locusthillvt.org/author/locusthillcondo/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Large, organized community willing to litigate to enforce standards; highly vigilant regarding property boundaries and aesthetics.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via Clagett Management; expect strict scrutiny of any visual impacts or boundary encroachments. The HOA has demonstrated willingness to go to court over aesthetic/covenant disputes.

neighbors.profile_summary: Active and litigious HOA for a golf course community; recently won a court case regarding covenant enforcement.
